content: This PR (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/71780) is waiting on team consensus
I think the PR have a few comments that needs to be resolved first.
@Lukas Kalbertodt I feel that str and slice behaves very differently as for Pattern API.
str is more flexible while slice is very restrictive, a lot of signatures is very different so one cannot just convert str Pattern API methods to slice.
Uhm, I'm not sure I understand your message :/
Also note that I haven't followed any pattern API design discussions...
Ping from triage, any updates on this issue?
Ping from triage, any updates on this issue?
There were some comments but the developer didn't update the code according the comments. Also, now the developer is busy and someone else needs to take over.
One thing is function constraint being weird and another one being not an efficient implementation which requires to allocate twice.
it needs redesign of the pattern API I think
which is not something the author should really be responsible for

This PR has been labeled S-waiting-on-team, hence will be included in the T-compiler meeting agenda of tomorrow:
https://hackmd.io/deNj8imkTaSwe4MloUeZDw#PRs-S-waiting-on-team

if anyone wants, feel free to jump in and/or add details/fixes to the summary I wrote about it

Oh it was waiting on the libs team, i guess. We discussed it last week and @Ashley Mannix said he'd look at it. I re-labeled as T-libs-impl because it's not a new stabilization, but forgot to remove the waiting-on-team label.
ok, then I'll remove that label myself (hope it's fine, otherwise I'll put it back ^^)
I am going to look at this soon :smile: FWIW itâ€™ll probably land with the HRTB and then block stabilization on reworking the pattern API to avoid it
